name: Hardest Tens, Hundreds, Thousands, or None Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many countries are there in the world?
questions.explanation:
Hundreds.

	In 2011 South Sudan split from Sudan and became the world's 196 country. Over 99 percent of voters in South Sudan voted to become an independent country from the rest of Sudan.

questions.text: Not including his sonnets, how many plays did William Shakespeare write?
questions.explanation:
Tens.

	William Shakespeare is believed to have written 37 plays. His first play was titled "The Two Gentlemen of Verona", which took place in the same town of Verona as his later work titled "Romeo and Juliet".

questions.text: On average, how many times would you expect your pet goldfish to blink in one hour?
questions.explanation:
None.

	Unlike humans and most other animals, fish do not blink at all. With the exception of sharks, fish do not have eyelids. Fish even sleep with their eyes open.

questions.text: How many times is the word "love" mentioned in the bible?
questions.explanation:
Hundreds.

	Some versions of the bible may be slightly different, but the "love" is mentioned 310 times in the King James Version, the most being found in the New Testament. Of course, the most used word in the bible is "Lord".

questions.text: In the "Gettysburg Address" Abraham Lincoln once said "Four score and seven years ago". About how many years was Lincoln referring to?
questions.explanation:
Tens.

	A score is twenty years, so "four score and seven years" is 87 years. Lincoln was referring to the beginning of the American Revolution in 1776, which took place "four score and seven years" before his speech.

questions.text: How many miles are in the Tour de France?
questions.explanation:
Thousands.

	There are a total of 2,200 miles in the Tour de France. If you were to drive a car non-stop at 60 miles per hour until you drove 2,200, it would take you about a day and a half. The cyclists of the Tour de France do not have to go non-stop though. The race is separated into several segments over a 21 day period.

questions.text: How many days elapsed between the Japanese bombing of Pearl Harbor and the day the United States entered World War II?
questions.explanation:
None.

	Within twenty-four hours of the bombing on Pearl Harbor, Congress had declared war on Japan and its allies. President Franklin Roosevelt called it "A date which will live in Infamy".

questions.text: How many Pokemon were there in the first season of the TV show?
questions.explanation:
Hundreds.

	In the first season titled "Indigo League", as well as many of the original games, there were 151 Pokemon. Many new Pokemon were introduced throughout the seasons.

questions.text: How many people lost their lives in the terrorist attacks on America on September 11, 2001?
questions.explanation:
Thousands.

	Nearly 3000 people were killed as a result of the terrorist attack claimed by Al Qaeda, destroying both twin towers of the World Trade Center, four airplanes, and damaging the Pentagon. Since that day security across the world has increased to try to prevent further attacks.

questions.text: How many years elapsed between the end of World War I and the beginning of World War II?
questions.explanation:
Tens.

	This time period, known as the Interwar Period, lasted for 21 years. During many of these years America suffered from the Great Depression.
